author: water_jedi_17
title: realistic mini set
review: The first clone wars mini,it comes with a polybag and actually looks like the real thing.66 pieces make it look just like the one seen in the film it has a landing pose and flying mode.One half comes with a republic insigna.The back comes with three blue pieces as the engines.The wings are held by stick-like pieces making it easily move it's wings.The front has a dagger like tip and one piece cockpit.Unfortunately it can't stand while in flying mode but then that's a problem for the larger v 19 torrnet.I higly recommend this to any clone wars or star wars fan.

author: PluffTed
title: Mini V-19 Torrent
review: I got this set yesterday at Target. I found it in the Easter Section along with 8033 Mini General Grievous' Starfighter in the bottom part of the aisle. This set is very detailed and looks alike to the bigger one. I love how they made the wings fold to attack position. I definetely think this set deserves a 4.

author: MandalorianCandidate
title: Better than the $55 original
review:
I know it’s only a MINI, but this is the Cadillac of MINIs!  I really dug the original MINI sets that came out in 2002 and were perpetuated the next few years.  Every time a new set comes out I get really jazzed because they are not that common any more and are a nice (and cheap!) way of getting Lego ships.

I thought this originally came out last year as a Brickmaster set, but I could be mistaken.  I actually bought the parts on bricklink and with instructions I found on the lego website made my own, but it’s nice to see it released by Target.

The wings don’t have a flipping mechanism like the full-scale 7674 set, but hey, it’s a MINI.  What do you want?!  They use a couple of simple, but sturdy, hinges instead.

The other nice detail is the stampographed republic insignia on the wing.  They could have gone the route of the clone battle pack and used a sticker instead.  

Even though that’s all it is, the MINI representation is a nicely scaled-down version that sticks faithfully to the design of the original…and that’s all we ask for, right?

Borrowing the rating method from fbtb.net...

price/parts ratio - 10/10
parts selection - 8/10
minifigs - N/A
construction - 8/10
design/sturdiness - 10/10
comparison to TV show - 10/10
swoosh factor - 10/10
reviewer's tilt - 10/10
FINAL SCORE – 9.4/10 ==> 5 of 5

author: donneyboy
title: looks like the real thing
review:
I got this set today, along with mini General Greivous Starfighter and it is awesome.first off it has details like the set, and the real ship. like the folding center wing, and two folding side wings. it is pretty big for $3.99. you get 66 pieces for 4 dollars. here are the pro's and con's of this set- 

Pros- 
folding wings
no stickers 
great price to piece ratio

cons- 
none

author: Starstreak
title: Can't get much more accurate at this scale. :)
review:
I did a full review here with photos:
http://www.eurobricks.com/forum/index.php?showtopic=26802&hl=

Here is the closing of that review:

Final thoughts

At $3.99 for 66 pieces, it's a good deal if you need parts from it. If not, there always the 8033 Lego Mini General Greivus set which "only" has 44 count, but still $3.99.

To see the full size pictures, please goto my flicker site: Mini V-19 Torrent

My rating:

Playability: 4 out of 5. It’s swooshable. It's a mini. Stick it in your jacket pocket and take it with you.
Design: 3 out of 5. Very good job. I think a few things could've made it better like what IlikePi said, "Where's the other republic insignia for the other wing?" 
Build experience: 2 out of 5. This was easy. As I mentioned before, hard to get it wrong with so little pieces.
Overall: 5 out of 5. It's $3.99. Even in Hawaii where there seems to be an automatic $5-30 price increase on most Lego sets when compared to the mainland. Well worth buying at least one.

author: darthdc
title: Best freebie thus far
review:
Got this today as part of the Mirror newspaper promotion - and the best thus far. Contains far more bricks than the others, and a great selection too.

Pros

Sturdy, well built
Wings fold upwards
No stickers

Cons

None

author: thewish
title: Best freebie I've had. LEGO, we worship you!
review:
The V-19 Torrent is the Repoublic Starfighter mainly used in the Clone Wars. The mini version of this came with a Mirror promotion and was virtually free. The set is very realistic for a mini set with folding wings and weaponry.

PROS-
Very realistic
Cheap
Folding wings
Great pieces

CONS-
None

You won't regret buying this on Ebay for a higher price.

author: Legomikos
title: Good design in Mini-scale
review:
The V-19 Torrent Starfighter was used by the Galactic Republic during the Clone Wars. It had two blaster cannons and two concussion missile launchers. Its speed and maneuverability were exceptional.

 

The set comes inside a small polybag:

http://www.brickshelf.com/cgi-bin/gallery.cgi?i=4768692

 

These are the pieces of the set:

http://www.brickshelf.com/cgi-bin/gallery.cgi?i=4768696

 

The building of the ship is very short. Firstly, we build the main body, and then add the engines and a small Technic structure, which serves as a landing gear and to build de central wing. We also build the cockpit

http://www.brickshelf.com/cgi-bin/gallery.cgi?i=4768702

 

Secondly, we build and add the center wing:

http://www.brickshelf.com/cgi-bin/gallery.cgi?i=4768703

 

Finally, we build the two lateral wings. The left wing has a white round tile 2x2 with the Republic's symbol.

http://www.brickshelf.com/cgi-bin/gallery.cgi?i=4768705

 

Completed model in flight mode:

http://www.brickshelf.com/cgi-bin/gallery.cgi?i=4768707

 

Comparison shot with the original model:

http://www.brickshelf.com/cgi-bin/gallery.cgi?i=4768693

 

Pros

  • Good recreation
  • Good design overall
  • Dark red pieces look nice
  • No stickers

Cons

  • Central wing is fragile 
  • Front part could have been done better

 

You can read a complete, extended review at: http://www.hispalug.com/foro/index.php?topic=11499.0

 

I hope this review is useful for you!
